notesStmt.note: Water-damaged, especially upper and lower margins.

The parchment flyleaf at the beginning and at the end: parts of Spanish calendar of the 14th to 15th century: [iv recto], [iv verso], [51r], [51v].Censored by Dominico Irosolomitano, Italian censor (active in the last quarter of the 16th and first quarter of the 17th century): inscribed with his name (folio 50v); see 61, and appendix § 62-74. Censored by Giovanni Domenico Carretto, Italian censor (active in the first quarter of the 17th century): inscribed with his name, 1628? (folio 50r); see 100-101, and appendix § 80-84.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.
